messages.content: “Who’s 'the boss' in this context? What happens if Grognaut remains alive?”
((Roll initiative))

Theodoric Mulligan swings his sword at Aeolian. "I'm sorry, Lord Burr!" It misses.

The Queen doesn't use her turn.
It's @Aeolian Burr's turn.

“There is no poison which can be linked to the life of a distant creature. That would not happen. The circumstances of this supposed ‘game’ are ill-defined at best.” I cast sanctuary on Locruz. “This is a waste of everyone’s time.”
"Aeolian, this really isn't the time..." Aliza.

“It’s always the time. This is who I am.” I smile. “I tried… to avoid that, around you, Lydia. For absurd reasons I’m not entirely clear on. But there’s no reason to hold back anymore. I will win the argument.” He doesn’t do anything.

Washington hits you for 6 damage.

"Aeolian... Please. I don't want to die." Aliza
“…Then live. Unless you’re demanding I kill your father, which seems a bit out of character.” He doesn’t do anything.
"Just... Please try to actually solve something instead of arguing!" Aliza skips her turn because she has no idea what to do.
Locruz swings a fist at Washington. "He's the toughest of the two! I can concentrate his attacks on me, so you handle your employee guy!"
“Mmyes.” He murmurs, intents unclear.
Theo hits you for 5 damage. "Lord Burr, please fight back!"
The Queen laughs at this and does nothing.
It's @Aeolian Burr's turn!

“Oof. …To what end? Killing you? I’m unclear on why this is being taken seriously at all.”
He attempts to grapple Theo.
((The guy has to succeed at a NINE DC save))
"This is a joke, right...?" He rolls a nat 1 and is easily grappled anyway. "You're not really going tolet her die, are you?"
“No, certainly not. I’m fighting, see?” ((Uhhhh grappling counts as an action right I think that’s my turn lol))
Washington stabs Locruz.
Aliza tries to stab The Queen. This fails, since The Queen is floating out of reach.
Locruz tries to hit Washington and fails.
Unfortunate.
For him.
Theodoric tries to break free. ((Roll the grapple contest stuff))
Theo breaks free. He stabs you for 6 damage.
The Queen skips her turn.
It’s @Aeolian Burr’s turn!

*Ah. It would seem I’m probably going to die here.*

*What should my last action be? What do I do? How will they remember me? A violent, pathetic coward? An ideologically inconsistent brute who threw away everything to save themself? No. But then what…? Perhaps it doesn’t matter. I doomed myself long ago. Most battles… they are won before the war even starts.*

I take out my abacus from my bag. “…I’m sorry, Locruz. I don’t know if I’ll be able to win this one. And if I do not… My works are in your hands, Aliza! My legacy. You were always… probably someone who’d have done better with my resources.”

I am an artificer. The manipulation of items is my specialty. I infuse the abacus with *Homunculus Servant*, magically creating an animate being around the object which operates with it as its heart.

Aeolian turns to the Queen with the most insufferably arrogant smile possible. “…It’s a metaphor.”

That’s his action. That’s his whole turn.

As Washington rushes to stab you, Aliza stands in his way. "Please… Stop. Dad, please… There has to be a solution."

"I’m trying to help you! All of this is about your future, Aliza! Even if you can’t see that!" Washington.

“From his point of view… given the presented dilemma… he *is* likely behaving in the most rational fashion. Were the time limit less stringent, it would be prudent to seek other options, however… given a pre-existing distaste for me, or even without that… rushing to complete the prerequisite for your affliction’s annulment is…” He takes a few deep breaths.

"You’re my friend, Aeolian." Aliza.

"Then you can find another after this." Washington shoves her aside.

"Ally… I trust you." She casts healing word, healing Aeolian for 7hp.
“Aha… I appreciate the sentiment, but…”
Locruz fails to punch Washington.
The whole building starts to shake.
“Wahgh.” This is noted.

The monster in the arena is now flying around smashing into walls. The mark of Cancer is glowing in black-colored light like wings on its back as it takes off into the sky.

"What!?" The Queen shouts. "That... Wasn't in the plans. Why didn't he mention it could do that?"

Aliza crumples to the ground, clutching at her throat and failing to breathe.

"Lady Hamill! What's going on!?" Theodoric rushes to her side. 

Despite the beast escaping, the building is still shaking. In fact, it seems like it's collapsing onto itself.
“Your game failed, I suppose. The time limit you set will not happen. Now annul the poison.”

"I'm afraid it... Won't be that simple." The bubble that held Aliza earlier forms around Theodoric and Aliza once more. Theodoric seems panicked and confused inside of it as he loses consciousness. "We won't be staying around for the ending, now. This is the end of our presence for now... But don't worry. This is just... The Overture." The Queen and people in the bubble vanish into thin air.
It's @Aeolian Burr's turn!
“It’s like she fancies herself some king of… The Overture.” Aeolian scowls. “Dammit! There’s no reason for us to fight anymore, is there?!”

"She’s… Gone." Washington stares in silence.

"I think the building’s gonna collapse! We have to get out of here!" Locruz.
“Dammit.” Aeolian grabs Washington to make sure he’s not stunned into immobility and gets a move on.

Washington runs as well.

You run into Donald going up the stairs. "The fuck’s going on up there!?"
Locruz dashes after you as well.
“The beast grew wings. Predictable, altogether. Fuck! Gods dammit.” He allows himself some out of character language.

"Shit, again!? I disabled that. Why did he have any of the magic to do that shit!?" Donald.

"The Queen shoved Yule and his gang into the arena!" Locruz.

"Oh, fuck off! Did she set all of this up then?" Donald.

"She set up far too little of it, I’d say." Washington.
“I’m not confident she has any real plan here.” I sigh. “Where could they have gone…?”

"Right now, you just need to get out of here before you die and waste your lives on this nonsense. I’ll be fine sticking by the boss. Head for the exit." Donald dashes up to the floor you were on.

Its @Aeolian Burr’s turn!

“I wonder what that guys motives are.” Aeolian mutters.

I continue running. Dash. As it goes.
Nash is carrying Harriet Dana Edwardson’s unconscious body on this floor. Washington and Locruz tail behind you.

Nash doesn’t say anything to that. He’s still rolling over the reality of what he’s seen in his head, like a whetstone, worn down to nothing.

*I don’t look anything like him. It’s a trick of the light. Orion’s delusional. I’m not…*
((Roll initiative))
((sorry for delay i had to deal with something im back))
((18 for initiative))
(( @Don'tAtmey are you too distracted rn))
((Half that and half no Juni))
((WEHHHH))
It's @Nash Edwardson's turn.
Nash swings his longsword at Linjamin.
((13 to hit.))
It misses.
((End turn?))
Ruth punches Linjamin 3 times, hitting twice.
Orion tries to shoot Linjamin and misses.

Harriet slides forward and cuts through Linjamin repeatedly. He grunts in pain. 

Linjamin leaps up into the air tosses throwing knives around. ((Roll a dex save))

((SORRY whoops.))

9 dex.
((sigh))

Nash is hit and takes 3 damage. 

It's @Nash Edwardson's turn.
Nash swings his longsword at Linjamin again. If it ain't broke...
21 to hit.
It hits.
10 for damage.
He snarls. ((Is that the end of your turn))
((Do I have more actions??))
((You have a bonus action and a move action yeah))
((If you actually can do anything with those depends on the player))
Oh, great. Nash uses his bonus action to cast Heal on himself, restoring 5 points of HP. His turn ends.

Donald Jameson dashes in from the stairs, ready to assist Linjamin. "Having trouble with the high priestess again, are we?" 

"Shut up!" Linjamin snarls.

Harriet looks terrified of him.
*Why the fuck is she scared? Is she stupid?* Nevertheless, Nash unconsciously moves his body in front of her, face twisted in a sneer. "You all are pathetic."
Ruth punches Linjamin twice. Both miss.
Orion hits Linjamin with an arrow. Linjamin is looking weak.
((not my turn yet?))

Harriet slashes Donald several times. "Die, you foul demon!"

"Hey… You’re the one begging to bring out the beast." Donald’s wounds heal back instantly as his body starts to expand.

"Goodbye, you sacks of shit." Linjamin enters stealth and vanishes from sight.
It’s @Nash Edwardson’s turn!
"*Shit!*" Nash hisses furiously. "Not this time, you asshole..!"
What's the layout of the room? Are there open doors or windows?
You’re in the hallway right now, which has pretty much countless exits. Most of them are closed doors but you don’t really have a way to seal off the staircases.
Ah, fuck.
Nash casts *tremors*, hoping to destabilize Linjamin and knock him over while he's attempting to flee.
((Is that earth tremors? What specific spell))
((It's a cantrip))
((this))
((Oh prestidigitation))
((That's a homestuck word bruh))
((Is that the end of your turn))
((Yes))

Donald transforms into a beast akin to the one that killed you days ago. On his forehead is a third eye, however. It takes a few moments of it lighting up oddly for you to realize that that’s… Harriet’s eye. He casually swipes her out of the way, sending her crashing into a wall painfully. "Ha… You really didn’t think that through, did you?" He detransforms.

"What the fuck?!" He yells, outraged. *Why are you hurting her? Are you stupid? That's not the sort of thing that's supposed to happen to her. What the fuck?? She's the one that humiliates me. Is this... augh.*
"Are you joking? She was the only one worth caring about. Am I supposed to be scared of you, Nashie-boy?" Donald.

*Shut the fuck up. I'm a serious person. I'm a legitimate threat. Kill yourself. You don't understand anything. You tossed her aside like she was garbage, and I'm supposed to believe this is because you respect her as a threat?*

Nash uses a spell slot to cast Divine Smite on himself, and then attempts to hit Donald with his longsword.
((10 to hit))
((Also I think the spell slot usage happens after it connects so if this misses we can just say he didn't do that whoops lmao did things in the wrong order))
((It’s not your turn 🤓))
Ruth hits Donald 3 times, one of them critting and the other 2 simply hitting. "…Ow?" He says this almost sarcastically.
Orion misses his shot.
Harriet remains unconscious.
It’s @Nash Edwardson’s turn!
Nash swings his longsword.
7 to hit.
It misses. ((Even if you used 10 from earlier it would miss lmao))
((i imagined yeah))
((end turn))
The whole building starts to shake.
Nash yelps. "The fuck?!?"
The building is starting to collapse. Bits of ceiling fall down around you. "Shit... What's going on!?" Donald rushes up the stairs.
Nash begins chasing after him.
((Ermmm not your turn. But I’ll let you sort of imply you’re doing that visually))
"Nash, wait! We need to go down! The building is crumbling!" Ruth.
"He's going to get away!" He yells.
Ruth runs down the stairs.
"Nash, if he can survive the building crumbling with him inside we can’t kill him! Come on!" Orion rushes down the stairs.
Harriet remains unconscious and alone on this floor.
It’s @Nash Edwardson's turn!

Nash's eyes flicker back and forth between Harriet, slumped on the ground, and the quickly disintegrating building.

*Fuck! That stupid bitch! Why'd she let herself get hurt like that..?!? Ugh. Fine! Fuckin' fine! If I don't rescue her, Mother will be angry, surely. I have to. I've no other choice.*
He runs over to Harriet and attempts to sling her unconscious body onto his back.
((Roll strength))

As you pick up Harriet, you watch the stairs headed down collapse into themselves. Gore splatters against the walls. Ruth and Orion wouldn’t have had time to make it all the way down. And now the building is rapidly crumbling all around you.

His heart stops. He can feel it, the jolt, something integral to his functioning *halting*, just like that. As if he was never alive to begin with. As if none of them were.

*It's okay. They'll be fine. Can you gather up their pieces? You can do that, can't you? You were revived, once. They can be... everyone can be... pieced back together. Needle and thread. You can do that, right?*

Aeolian, Locruz, and Washington exit the staircase leading up together. 

It’s *your* turn again.

One of the sets of stairs has collapsed. Beneath the rubble, there's an enormous coagulation of blood, the product of someone - or some*ones* - being crushed very quickly and with extreme prejudice. Nash, currently balancing an unconscious Harriet Dana Edwardson on his back, stares at the carnage, completely frozen.
“Oh. That’s gore.” I shake my head. “You should probably be fleeing here.” I endeavor to remember this boy’s name.
"Dorrance? What are you doing here!?" Washington.
There’s no fucking way it was Dorrance.

Nash turns his head to stare at Washington, eyes somewhat unfocused. "Washington...?" He mumbles, sounding not at all there. "I'm supposed to kill you, I think."

His eyes slide back to the bloodied pile of trapped meat. "Do either of you know how to revive someone...? Do you need their hair, or some of their blood, or something...?"

"No clue." Locruz.

"I can’t let you do that, Nash. So if you’re gonna try to kill me… You better make it fast before I take you out first." Washington.
“Revive as in already dead…? Nothing I can do then…”

"Right." He says hollowly. "I should... right. The appropriate response, the, uh... I don't know what, I, don't, um..."

His mutters grow even more slurred, incoherent. "*Yes*, already dead, are you stupid...? Something like *that's* not a thing anyone can survive, and not a thing caused by a person, I mean.. when *I* died, there was a source, or, a cause, but this, um, there's not.. I don't understand."

He turns to face Washington, still moving sluggishly. "Take me out first? I can't allow that." He draws his sword. "She'd be upset with me."

He attempts to cut Washington's head off.
((Roll to hit))
Aeolian sighs. *MEN.*
22 to hit.
It hits.
Does it successfully take his head off?
((Roll damage and we’ll see))
((i just feel like taking someone's head off is an either you succeed and they die or you dont hit them it doesnt seem like a damage thing but fineeee))
10 for damage.

It doesn’t fully sever the head, but he collapses to the ground with a deep gash in his neck. "Ghah- Ghhhh…" He’s bleeding severely as the building continues to collapse. 

If that’s the end of Nash's turn, it’s @Aeolian Burr’s turn.
That's the end of Nash's turn.

….Uuuuugh. Do I *have to*???

Aeolian casts Spare the Dying on Washington.
((Is that the end of your turn))
Yeah, I guess? Aeolian sort of like, tries to lift him up.
"What the fuck are you doing???" Nash barks.
“Look, I don’t *really* care, but this is my very good friends father, and it’s like… she’d be pissed if he died? Especially if I was around when he did.” He makes a ‘you know how it is’ expression.

"That wasn’t enough, Dorrance. You fail." Washington splashes water at him and casts control water. The following mix of crashing waves and crumbling building are so chaotic you barely process the next few moments until you’re split apart. ((Channel split))
You and Washington land in front of the coliseum’s main entrance as the Acting Emperor Asturian approaches with an army of guards.
“Oh, great.” I roll my eyes.

"Excellent work, Baron. Guards, seize that man." Asturian commands them and they obey, arresting him. "Take him to the dungeon."

"…Damn it." Washington.

“I’m okay with this.” I nod. “The supposed Queen of the underground, real name Lydia Skylar, has kidnapped Ms. Hamill and one of my men with unclear intentions. I am going to try to… address that. I should hope I can trust… the *ever reliable* federal government to handle the autopsy of this building’s mayhem?”

"Indeed, of course, of course." Asturian handles this as Washington is dragged away.

"Aeolian! Whenever you can, come to me! I need to tell you what’s really going on!" Washington is dragged away.

"Hm. If he stays silent, you can come speak with him tomorrow morning. That shall be all." Asturian.

“…Okay.” I sigh. There’s work to be done. …What the work is, I am not entirely sure.

There is no one left here who matters to me. I walk in the direction of my base of operations.
You arrive back home.

I get to work studying the implications of the new abacus based entity I created today, and also looking into the information I have about the criminal underworld to rescue Aliza that too.

How late in the day is it?
Pretty late. You might want to get some sleep for the finale.

Whatever that means.

Aeolian tries to pull an all-nighter, obsessed with his research and anything he might have missed that could solve all this and stop Aliza from getting captured every five seconds. But he presumably fails eventually and succumbs to rest.
Aeolian wakes up once more in the marsh. "Welcome back, descendant of the Burr line."
“Ah, right. Hello.”
"You have failed to glimpse the truth. Would you like to attempt a theory regardless?"
“Oh, I failed, did I?”
"You have reached the end. Your number of possible paths to the conclusion now rest at... Only one. Do you believe in your ability to reach the climax?"
“…Yes? Quite an odd question. I believe myself capable?”
"It is not a question which possesses an answer. All you may do is propose your theory."
“For what? Is this about the emperor’s death, still?”
"This entire incident is."
"Though, I shall remind you he has not perished yet."
“Indeed. I’ve lost track of time. It feels as though it’s been… quite a while since then. Even though it was merely days ago.”
"Then you would forfeit your right to a guess?"

“…I didn’t say that.” I look at the ground. “The first time we met, you didn’t actually ask me who killed the emperor, did you? It was about what Asturian was doing. Why he wasn’t around for the discovery of the body. You followed up on that, but of course, I’d seen little related to the topic in the day between.”

I pace in the dregs of the march.
“The emperor is on death’s door after an assassination attempt. There are many who did not like him. The hellhounds… through Locruz, they have seemingly denied responsibility. Not that I can place full faith in his words, but a gang of thieves lying to save face is… odd. Washington was a suspect, but Nash is apparently able to affirm his alibi. …And of course it wasn’t directly Asturian.”
"You are correct in all of this."
"So where does the blame lie?"
I grimace. “Okay, he definitely didn’t try to kill himself, right? That would be ludicrous, even by my own standards.”
“It just feels as though it would be a bit dishonest to have this whole affair if it weren’t actually a murder attempt.”
"Is that your theory?"

“We’re running low on suspects. I had ruled out the Duchess… though I’m not entirely clear on why. I don’t think it’s her, though. I guess it could just be Lydia? I’ll own up to the severe lapse in my judgement with regards to her. But I feel she would have admitted it along with her grand villainous posturing if she were responsible.”
I sigh.
“Is there a point to this? Is this dream meant to imply that… I don’t know, had I solved this, I’d have changed the path of history? I’m not even certain it matters, sans the principle of giving his highness closure and justice. The political outcome is unaltered.”
"That mystery is beyond your capabilities."

I chuckle. “Well, alright. I still think it might be Lydia, but it would be kind of boring if I got that right now. I guess I’ll swing for the fences and say the ridiculous thing, sure. If I’m right it would be a pretty impressive deduction. Emperor Aragon, either directly or indirectly, killed himself.”
"Is that your final guess?"

“Well, now you’re laying on the pressure and making me think I’m missing something obvious. But really… I mean, Selle is suspicious as all hell, but I have nothing to link to the crime there. …If I only had more time, I’d be able to manage something better.”
"It is a yes or no question. You have still not answered it."
“Sure. That’s the guess.”

"Incorrect. Perhaps I would offer more insightful final corrections normally but the most obvious issue for you to realize is that no one has been killed in the first place."

You wake up in your study.
“Okay, obviously I meant as the culprit for the *attempt*, god. I literally went over how he wasn’t *actually* dead, that was already part of the acknowledged premise!”
Aeolian says this to nobody in the study.
It’s morning. He can probably go see Washington now.
I go to do that, yeah. Presumably some prison. If I don’t know I ask around at the people I’d need to in order to know.
He’s at the castle dungeon. He’s not the only one in the cells but he’s brought out to speak with you alone. "Aeolian… I think we’re all out of time."
“Yes, it’s the climax, apparently. Whatever that means.”

"I was trying to kill the Duchess on the Queen’s orders… Because this is her power play. I’ve been thinking about this more since I was in prison… But there’s no one left to stop her. The Hellhounds were the last domino in the way… And now they’re scattered momentarily. She’ll make use of this time. She has to."

“Scattered…? Lydia seemed to allude to receiving intel and orders from someone else, incidentally.” I sigh. “Wasn’t she with the hellhounds? Frank’s the one who kidnapped you the other day. Or, I guess that was a temporary alignment of circumstances.”

"I don’t know the queen’s plans. But Linjamin was retrieving me for her. Yes, she’s with the hellhounds. But everything collapsed with the building. They need time to regroup. Time the duchess has primed herself to use."

“Ah, by ‘she’ you meant the Duchess, okay. That makes more sense.”  I shake my head. “Language really needs more disambiguating pronouns. Anyway, I don’t think I’ve heard from or seen the Duchess since two days ago, so, I suppose she could be off plotting, that would align. I rather dislike her, but… ugh.” I hold my head. “Look, what the fuck is going on??? The emperor still isn’t even dead, right? It’s been days, how can he be in critical not-likely-to-survive condition that long??? Who killed him? Do you know? I keep getting harassed over not knowing. And how, oh, actually NO ONE killed him, because he still has not DIED. I am trying very, very hard to comprehend the plot here, I really am. Why would Lydia — whose, as Wazy Emerson would call it, ‘third-year syndrome’ name is too self important for me to take seriously — capture Theo and Aliza? Aliza has a connection to you, but the inclusion of the other makes it clear this is about targeting *me*, which doesn’t make *sense*! Not once has my role in this mattered, have I been seriously floated as part of this power play. I have very strong and successful control over my barony, but that’s *it*, and I highly doubt anyone perceives a threat of me imminently expanding it when even just trying to investigate what everyone else is doing has nearly gotten me killed several times. You don’t know The Queen(tm)’s plans, fine, but what *do* you know? Is the thing you called out to me to meet with you to tell me just that, the Duchess is trying to make a power play? Because, yeah, that’s probably something she would do!”

I catch my breath.
“…Sorry. Losing my composure a bit.”

"Theodoric was her spy sent to watch you. I don't know his deal beyond that. The point is I think she's going to kill the emperor soon. You need to stop her. Do something good for once in your life. No one else can even try anymore."

“The Duchess’s spy?! Him? Really? Huh.”
I am completely caught off guard by this stunning revelation.
"No, the Queen's- Look. Stop wasting time. For all we know she's already started making moves!"
“…Okay, and this time ‘she’ *does* mean the Duchess, though. Where are you expecting me to go? Whatever facility they’re holding the emperor at?”
"He should just be in his room."
“Oh.” That feels… huh. “I seriously doubt if something happens I’ll make a difference the existing guards set up won’t, but, I’ll check on him in your stead, I suppose.”
He grumbles and returns to his cell.
Aeolian heads off, and ensuring he has the equipment he’d need if things go wrong, goes to where the emperor should dwell.
The Duchess and Nash are there. ((End session))

You and Harriet end up inside of the central part of the coliseum. Donald and The Devil of Soltaria are inside. The ceiling has already crumbled, so you should be safe here.

"Jeez, you’re persistent." Donald chuckles.

"You know this child?" The Devil.

Nash breathes heavily, covered in blood and water. Sopping wet cat left out in the rain, etc.

"Washington... where'd he...?" He mutters incoherently, eyes darting all over the room.
"Washington? Please, who cares about that guy? You just brought back the boss’s favourite plaything! Come on, let’s wake your sister up." Donald approaches with confident and smug footsteps.

His gaze continues to skitter, confused. He might have a mild concussion.

"Where are Ruth and Orion...? Where did they go...?"
"I dunno who that even is. Dead, I guess? Just the four of us left." He tries to take your sword from you.
Nash's hand remains on the hilt of his sword. "I need to... there was a thing, I need to... I need to kill Washington." He says.
"It doesn’t matter anymore, kid. I’m about to kill you for the boss."

"Oh." He says dully. "That doesn't sound right. Why would your boss want that?"

His shoulders tremble slightly. "I've failed."
"Yeah, no shit." He takes the sword from you.
Nash allows this to happen.

"That's enough, Donald." The Devil.

"Huh? Why?" Donald.

The Devil approaches you and lifts you by the collar, staring into your eyes. "Hahaha... This boy. He intrigues me."

Nash chokes slightly, throat spasming. An extended internal monologue on how he should be put to death for failing his mother cuts itself short at the sensation of being drawn up, like water from a well, for the sake of being examined by perhaps one of the most dangerous men in the kingdom. Looking at *Nash.* Like he's valuable. Like he's - not like he's a person, exactly, but like there's still use to be extracted from him.
"What?" Confused.
"What's your name?"
He blinks. "Nash." *Do I deserve to be an Edwardson? Have I earned that? I haven't.*

"Gnash... So you are a nameless one too, then? The bearer of a title alone. I like that. But you're weak." The Endless Eclipse drops you to the ground. "Too weak. Gain strength for yourself. And then... You're going to try to kill me. Do you understand, boy?"

"Bwuh??" Nash says. *What? Why would he ask that? Is he stupid?*

"Kill you? You didn't do anything."

"I have done more than you can imagine, Gnash. Now all I want is to find one who can match with my strength in combat. I want to see what the pinnacle of humanity shall be. Who shall be the one to finish me off? I want to see you try to be that. Like your sister once did. So that I may snuff your fire out as well. Now tell me. Do you understand?"

He stares up at The Devil.

*Is that a thing I'm capable of...? It must be. Otherwise, why would he bother? Can he see it in me? Some potential? Did he see it in Harriet, too?*

*I...*

Nash pulls himself to his feet. "I understand." He says hoarsely.

"Boss, are you su-" Donald is interrupted by both him and The Endless Eclipse disappearing. Beyond where they were standing, you can see a hole in the rubble large enough for you and Harriet to get out of.
Mechanically, as if puppeted, Nash picks up Harriet in a bridal carry and walks over to the hole. He peers down it.
It's like a hole in the wall. You can just step through it.
He steps through.
The Duchess is waiting on the other side. "Well done, Nash."
"You did great, Nash. You can rest now." She pets Nash on the head as he suddenly feels so tired.
Nash sways back and forth on his feet, exhaustion overtaking him as he does so. He leans forwards, resting his forehead against the curve of The Duchess's shoulder, eyes fluttering shut. "Mom..."
"Shhh... Rest well. I'll be needing your help to end all of this tomorrow."
He nods. "I love you..." A soft, scared admission.

"I know."

Nash is in the marsh once again. "Welcome back, ward of the duchess."
He stares up at the sky. "Where are Ruth and Orion...? Are they okay??" He demands.
"I do not provide information, ward of the duchess. I am the one who tests you. So tell me... What did Imperial Prince Asturian VII return to Soltaria for? It was an item you have held yourself."
"Uh...." Nash considers, trying to piece together his fragmented memories. "The sheet of metal? With the runes on it?"
"Correct. But you cannot translate it yourself, can you?"
"No. Am I supposed to be able to...? I'm sorry."
"It matters not to this tale. The question now is… Where was Asturian during the stabbing then?"
He tilts his head to the side, confused. "You said yourself he was unconscious, right? He was attacked in the basement."
"Correct. Right in front of where that metal sheet was. Therefore… Did he have anything to do with the stabbing?"

Nash bites his fingernail, thinking. "Was the sheet some sort of.. communication array? Ruth said he hired an assassin.... but Burr seemed convinced he wasn't involved in the murder, and *you* also said he had different plans..."
It waits for an answer.
"No...?" Nash's voice pitches up at the end, like he's asking a question.
"Correct. Then who is the culprit?"
"The assassin?"
"And the assassin is…?"

*So, the person in the photo was the one attacking the acting emperor at the time, I suppose. That checks out. But I don’t know who else it would have been other than them. What other assassins are there…?*

“Linjamin..?” He guesses, voice wavering slightly.

"Incorrect. Goodbye, ward of the duchess. This is the end of this incident."

Nash wakes up in his bed. The Duchess is sitting next to his bed.

“Mother?” He manages, voice still a little strangled from sleep. 

The memories from yesterday hit him in full. His breath catches.

*I failed. They died. Ruth and.. Orion. Crushed under rubble. Useless. Empty shells. And even after all of that, I couldn’t muster up the energy to feel real anger. Resentment. I didn’t avenge anyone. I let myself be manhandled and discarded. I don’t deserve to be an Edwardson. I haven’t earned a single thing. Who am I to believe the world owes me respect? I’m like…*

*No. Stop that thought in its tracks, right now. You heard Mom. The girls from the brothel were powerful. ARE powerful. Strong enough to ensnare any man. It was a display of authority from them, was all. Why would you compare yourself to a prostitute? Are you sick in the fucking head?*

Nash can feel something - happening. He can’t do this. Not in front of his mother. Not in front of The Duchess. But it occurs anyways. His eyes prick with hot, angry tears. He leans over and begins to cry, right in front of her.
"Is something the matter, Nash?"
He frantically tries to wipe away his tears. “I’m - hic - I’m sorry, I shouldn’t, mother, I..” Nevertheless, it continues.
"Whats wrong? Your sisters are both fine, if you’re still worried about them."

“T-that’s good.” Another hiccup. “M-my commanding officer. And my… my partner. They both died. During the attack.” His face scrunches up, miserable. “Because of me. Because I told them to go there. And I couldn’t kill Washington. I’m sorry.”
"It’s alright. It doesn’t really matter if they died, does it?"
He blinks, eyes wide. “What..? But.. they, I mean, I…” He stammers.
"Why would it matter, Nash?"
“Because, they were… important to me?” He mumbles. He’s confused. Is this a trap? Is he not allowed to.. have that?
"They’re corpses now. They shouldn’t matter anymore. They’ve fulfilled their purpose."
He trembles, eyes filling with tears again. “I miss them. I don’t want them to be dead.”
"You’ll forget them soon enough. They didn’t matter." She stands up and holds out her hand for Nash to take. "You still have a duty to fulfill, Nash."

…
He grabs her hand. He feels unstable, quivering like a stretched bowstring.
"Come, Nash." She leads him out of the room. "It’s time for me to claim the throne."
He follows her silently.
They arrive at the castle. The Duchess heads towards where you saw the emperor sleeping.
Nash… follows her…

Acting Emperor Asturian runs into them as he exits the tower’s stairs. "Duchess Edwardson! To what do I owe the pleasure?" He looks nervous.

"Do you believe you have what it takes to stand up to me, foolish prince?" The Duchess smiles in pure euphoria.

"Wh-What?" Asturian looks at Nash. "Him! So you were working with him in all of this? This framing me?"

Nash allows his expression to twitch, assembling itself into a bitter smile. Yes. This is right. This is how things ought to be. Me and Mother, punishing him for his sin. The worst sin in the world. To raise a hand against family.

*But you know he didn’t do it. You know it couldn’t have been him. He didn’t hire the assassin. You know who serves to benefit the most from all of this. You’ve known since the very beginning.*

Shut up. That’s not important. The only important thing right now is making Asturian beg for his pathetic life, isn’t it…? To make him feel it. All of it.
Nash takes a step forwards and laughs, guttural. “You’re pathetic, Asturian.”

"Indeed. Now, you don’t have to keep my seat warm anymore. All my enemies are too crippled to stop my ascent. Do you believe yourself to be the exception, Asturian?" The Duchess.

"Wh-What!? You’re going to kill my brother?" Asturian.

"He doesn’t seem to be leaving. Nash… Why don’t you handle him? He’s slowing us down." The duchess.
Nash smiles, eyes wild. “With pleasure.” *Die. Die. Die. You piece of shit. Die.*
Nash pulls out his longsword.

"Agh! Ahhhhhhh-!" He runs off like a coward.

"Hm. It’s fine. He was never even a threat worth considering. I doubt the AMO would even bat an eye no matter what he did."
He grits his teeth, but lowers his sword regardless. “I can chase after him, if you want…”

"Perhaps latter. You’re here as my bodyguard so I don’t have to waste my energy on these desperate scraps of opposition."

((End session))

As your mind drifts away, you finally place where you've seen that sword before.
The last time you saw it, it was buried in a similar position. But not into the ground. ...Into Emperor Aragon's body.

You lose consciousness.
Selle is in the marsh once again. "Welcome back, nameless ideologue."

"The blinding light, once more..."
Selle grabs their head.
*Even with these dreams... I still didn't figure it out, because I was too naive, too trusting, even with my suspicions.*
"You have finally glimpsed the truth. But you should still have questions, no?"
"I do... What would someone from Meleke like Erik gain by making Asturian the emperor? ...This just makes me feel so lost. He told me his story, so I understand his animosity towards Soltaria but..."
"Let us begin simply. Who stabbed the emperor?"
"Erik did. It has to have been him."
"Correct. Then… How was he able to be in the tavern in the morning?"
"He left through the catacombs."

"The hole in the roof I thought Grognaut smashed someone through, he dropped in through there."
"Correct. Erik Mussa falsified his alibi to make himself look innocent in the stabbing. Now, for the important question. Was he a lone agent or a pawn in a greater plan?"
"I recall him speaking with Grognaut, asking why he was chosen, saying he was dissapointing him. I think this has to be part of a greater plan, and that the two are inexplicably linked together."
"You are partially correct. Grognaut is not in the plan, however. He is a child, incapable of willingly participating in this plan. So who, pray tell, hired him?"
"It can't be anyone but Asturian."
"Incorrect." You wake back up in Laura’s office after a long rest. Only Erik is here, looking smug. "Morning, Yule. Or would you prefer another name?"

"Shit!"
Selle stands up in anger.
*Who else could it be? The AMO? The Hellhounds?*
Selle looks at Erik. "Where's Laura?"
"No clue. Should be fine, though. Is that all you have to ask?"

"It was just my first question."
Selle sighs and sits back down.
"It's like you yourself knew what I was dreaming about. I've asked you before but, what the hell is your deal? Is this related to what happened in Meleke?"
"Is what related?"

Selle feels a sharp pain in their right arm and winces with vigor.
"God damn it. Wait a second."
*What am I gonna do if he just kills me right here? If he's a pawn, then I'm the same. This stupid arm isn't making anything better.*
Selle takes a pill, dry, and continues.
"I know you killed the emperor. I mean, I should have known earlier, but I was too naive. The usual."
"Kill's a strong word. He's alive... For now." Erik smirks. "I'm not an assassin, after all. I don't get hired simply to kill people."

Selle looks down a bit to think about this.
"but... why? Why plunge so many people of the empire into a panic by incapacitating such a popular figure to replace them with someone so domineering. I understand that someone would benefit from this but...  It's just too cruel. I honestly feel bad for the Edwardsons now."
"Ha... That's funny. Who did you think set this up? Come one... No one with a brain really thinks Asturian's going to be in charge for long."
"What are you saying?"
"The Duchess. She's the mastermind behind all of this. Well... Some of it. I did take things somewhat offscript. I just can't help myself, y'know?"

"Haha... That does make my last statement funny... Damn."
Selle sighs.
"Yeah, that makes a lot of sense. So, what now? Am I at your mercy?"
"No? Why would you be? My job ended a long time ago. I just needed to kill Grognaut but he's fled far away now... So I suppose that'll have to wait."

Selle heaves a sigh of relief.
"Well. That's good to hear I guess. I was preparing myself to be another pawn in this whole scheme."
"...What happened yesterday? After, Grognaut flew off and I passed out, I mean."

"The whole building fell so I had to bring you back. Guess even the Queen of the Night is no match for The Dungeon Master, hm? Oh, right... I never told you about that. That's my true title. I am Erik Mussa, The Dungeon Master. I cannot lose in any situation I orchestrate or am allied with someone in that position. In short, I physically could not lose until I drifted too far trying to kill Grognaut. He's called The Murder Hobo, in case you were wondering. Self-explanatory title, I'd hope."

*I hope Laura is fine. Obviously she's the main person I get work from but I'd obviously be worried about someone that I've known for a while like that.*
"I'm really hoping all those people are alright... Grognaut has a title? Isn't he a child?"
"A child with the mark of Cancer, yes. Anyone with the mark of cancer has a title."
"I see. Why does he need to be killed, anyway?"
"I’ve got no interest in discussing the business of the Order of Cancer with you. After all… You’ve got somewhere you should be right now."

"What?"
Selle stands up.
"I said he was still alive, right? But I doubt he’ll be for long. The duchess is making her move."

"You're right."
Selle rushes out of the room, towards the catacomb entrance to the Palace.
